feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RISING WATER LEVELS ON SMALL STREAMS AND CREEKS DRAINING THE BROOKS RANGE... A series of fronts will impact the region, bringing copious amounts of widespread rain that will cause water levels to rise on small streams and creeks draining the Brooks Range. Rainfall totals will range from 1.50 to 2.50 inches, with localized amounts
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 2:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...ELEVATED SURF LIKELY ON THURSDAY... Strong south winds to gale force will move into the West Coast and bring elevated surf to parts of Norton Sound and the Yukon Delta on Thursday. Wave action will be the greatest along south facing coastlines, with anticipated surge values of 2-4 feet above the normal high tides. The highest values will likely impact northern
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 1:12PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 3:30AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Locally Dense Valley Fog This Morning... Locally dense fog has developed in the valleys early this morning. Visibilities will be reduced to less than a quarter of a miles at times. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 3:08AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Patchy Dense Fog Through the Morning Commute... Patchy dense fog will continue through the morning commute, especially in river valleys and other low-lying areas. Dense fog is expected to lift by 10 AM. Motorists should remain alert for quick changes in visibility, dropping below a quarter mile at times. Use low-beam headlights and allow extra stopping distance.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 4:32AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HAZARDOUS DRIVING CONDITIONS POSSIBLE THROUGH THE EARLY MORNING COMMUTE... Areas of dense fog will reduce the visibility below one-half mile through the early morning commute. entry.title: Flood Watch issued August 22 at 1:58PM CDT until August 23 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bastrop, Bexar, Caldwell, Comal, Guadalupe, Lee, Medina and Uvalde. * WHEN...Through Wednesday afternoon.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bastrop; Bexar; Caldwell; Comal; Guadalupe; Lee; Medina; Uvalde

cap:geocode.value: TXZ193 TXZ194 TXZ203 TXZ204 TXZ205 TXZ206 TXZ207 TXZ208

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 22 at 10:40AM CDT until August 25 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Trinity River Near Rosser affecting Kaufman and Ellis Counties. For the Trinity River...including Dallas, Rosser, Trinidad, Long Lake (Oakwood)...elevated river levels are forecast. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
